meanings.definition: To deviate from a straight course
meanings.sent1: The car began to yaw as the driver lost control on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: The boat started to yaw off course due to the strong currents.
meanings.sent3: The kite decided to yaw left instead of right, causing a funny twist in the sky.
meanings.sent4: His attention started to yaw towards the window, away from the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle seemed to yaw wildly, unable to find true north.

meanings.definition: A side-to-side movement of an aircraft or ship
meanings.sent1: The airplane's yaw during turbulence made the passengers feel queasy.
meanings.sent2: The ship's yaw in the storm caused items to fall off the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected yaw of the plane made the flight attendants stumble comically.
meanings.sent4: The ship's yaw resembled a dance on the rough waves of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The sudden yaw of the aircraft startled the passengers, making them grab their seats.

meanings.definition: A rotation around the vertical axis of a vehicle
meanings.sent1: The car's yaw during the sharp turn impressed the racing fans.
meanings.sent2: The helicopter's yaw allowed it to change direction swiftly in the air.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder's unexpected yaw made him spin in circles, much to the amusement of onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful yaw on stage captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The pilot's precise yaw maneuver avoided a collision in mid-air.
